alert.note: Alert for Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 12 at 1:30PM MST until August 12 at 3:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MST/3 PM PDT/ THIS AFTERNOON FOR WEST CENTRAL YUMA AND SOUTHEASTERN IMPERIAL COUNTIES... At 130 PM MST /130 PM PDT/, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms produced heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Yuma, Fortuna Foothills, Araby, Winterhaven and Blaisdell. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 8 near mile marker 1...and between mile markers 10 and 16...and between mile markers 2 and 3. AZ Route 95 between mile markers 29 and 36. AZ Route 195 between mile markers 16 and 25. CA Interstate 8 between mile markers 91 and 96. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
